meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors intended to gain favor or approval from someone.
meanings.sent1: Her ingratiations with the teacher included bringing him coffee every morning.
meanings.sent2: She made subtle ingratiations with her colleagues by complimenting their work.
meanings.sent3: His ingratiations with the boss involved always agreeing with everything he said.
meanings.sent4: The politician's ingratiations with the voters were evident in his constant smiling and handshaking.
meanings.sent5: The cat's ingratiations with its owner involved purring and rubbing against their legs.

meanings.definition: The act of trying to make oneself more attractive or agreeable to others.
meanings.sent1: Through her ingratiations, she hoped to be more popular at school.
meanings.sent2: His ingratiations with his crush included buying her flowers and chocolates.
meanings.sent3: The dog's ingratiations with the mailman involved wagging its tail and licking his hand.
meanings.sent4: The actor's ingratiations with the audience were evident in his charming smile and engaging performance.
meanings.sent5: Her ingratiations with her new neighbors included baking them cookies and offering to help with chores.
